text: There, shut into her own room, that she might be prevailed on to make his fortune. #PrideAndPrejudice

passages.fragment: There , shut into her own room ,
passages.full_quote: <used>There, shut into her own room, a</used>s soon as their visitor left them, she could think without interruption of all that she had heard

passages.fragment: her own room , that she might
passages.full_quote: Elizabeth received her congratulations amongst the rest, and then, sick of this folly, took refuge in <used>her own room, that she might</used> think with freedom

The first half-hour was spent in piling up the fire, lest she should suffer from the change of room; and she removed at his desire to the other side of the fireplace<used>, that she might be</used> further from the door

passages.fragment: that she might be prevailed on to
passages.full_quote: Elizabeth's eyes were fixed on her with most painful sensations, and she watched her progress through the several stanzas with an impatience which was very ill rewarded at their close; for Mary, on receiving, amongst the thanks of the table, the hint of a hope <used>that she might be prevailed on to</used> favour them again, after the pause of half a minute began another

passages.fragment: be prevailed on to make his fortune
passages.full_quote: He bore with philosophy the conviction that Elizabeth must now become acquainted with whatever of his ingratitude and falsehood had before been unknown to her; and in spite of every thing, was not wholly without hope that Darcy might yet <used>be prevailed on to make his fortune</used>
